title: Research
text:
PhD Research, University of Minnesota (Nov 2019 â€“ May 2024)
Graduate Research Assistant
Advisor: Dr.Â Karunya K. Kandimalla
My dissertation research focused on understanding how amyloid-beta (AÎ²) peptides and insulin resistance contribute to cerebrovascular dysfunction in Alzheimerâ€™s disease, with a special emphasis on the blood-brain barrier (BBB). Key accomplishments include:

ğŸ“Š Developed a population pharmacokinetic model to study AÎ² isoform trafficking and accumulation at the BBB endothelium.
Published in Molecular Pharmaceutics
ğŸ”¬ Conducted flow cytometry, western blot, and confocal imaging to investigate distinct molecular mechanisms of AÎ² uptake and intracellular trafficking in BBB endothelial cells.
Published in Molecular Pharmacology
ğŸ§  Established a compartmental PK model to deconvolve plasma kinetics of imaging tracers from dynamic SPECT/CT heart scans.
Published in Journal of Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics
ğŸ§ª Studied the effect of HDL mimetic peptides and gut microbiome metabolites on AÎ² accumulation using dynamic imaging and cellular assays.
Published in Molecular Pharmaceutics




4F effect on Amyloid beta PK



ğŸ§¬ Interpreted time-series transcriptomics of insulin-exposed BBB endothelial cells and co-authored the manuscript.
Published in NPJ Systems Biology and Applications
ğŸ” Built a quantitative systems pharmacology (QSP) model to simulate insulin signaling and VCAM1 expression in BBB endothelial cells. Integrated proteomics and transcriptomics to study vascular inflammation in Alzheimerâ€™s disease.
Published in CPT: Pharmacometrics & Systems Pharmacology

title: Research
text:
ğŸ§¬ Modeling Neurodegenerative Disease Progression
Modeling & Simulation Co-op, Biogen Inc.Â (Jan â€“ Jun 2023)
Clinical Pharmacology and Pharmacometrics
Supervisor: Dr.Â Jingxian (JC) Chen

ğŸ“ˆ Conducted model-based meta-analysis (MBMA) of MDS-UPDRS data to support early Parkinsonâ€™s disease (PD) trial design.
ğŸ§® Built nonlinear mixed-effect models (in NONMEM and Monolix) to describe disease progression and time-to-event outcomes.
ğŸ“Š Simulated longitudinal endpoint profiles to evaluate study designs and dosing strategies.
ğŸ—£ï¸ Presented modeling results and impact to internal project teams and stakeholders.
Presented at ACoP14
ğŸ§ª Developed a PK/PD model for antisense oligonucleotide (ASO) therapy in PD and simulated alternate regimens to inform dose optimization.

title: Research
section: ğŸ§ª Imaging Probe Development for Cancer Detection
text:
ğŸ§ª Imaging Probe Development for Cancer Detection
Undergraduate Research Assistant, Shanghai Jiao Tong University (Oct 2016 â€“ Jun 2019)
Advisor: Dr.Â Qingqing Meng

ğŸ§« Designed and synthesized bimodal NIR and PET imaging probes targeting CYP1B1 for early tumor detection.
ğŸ”¬ Evaluated binding affinity and selectivity in CYP1B1-overexpressing cancer cell lines using flow cytometry and confocal imaging.
ğŸ§  Performed in vivo/ex vivo biodistribution and tumor visualization imaging.
Published in J. Med. Chem. and ChemBioChem.

title: Zengtao Wang
text:
Hi there! My name is Zengtao Wang and I am a pharmacometrician working at Eli Lilly and Company. I am a PKPD scientist by training and I am passionate about applying quantitative modeling and simulation to drug development.


University of Minnesota, Twin Cities | Minneapolis, MN
PhD in Pharmaceutics | Sept 2019 - June 2024
Shanghai Jiao Tong University | Shanghai, China
B.S in Pharmacy | Sept 2015 - June 2019



Eli Lilly and Company | Indianapolis, IN
Advisor - Pharmacometrician | June 2024 - present

title: Personal Life
text:
Where it all beganâ€”surrounded by mountains and river valleys. 




A young teenager stepping into a bustling city full of possibilities.




Diving into science and shaping dreams.

A leap of faith and a heart full of hope.

title: Personal Life
text:
ğŸŒ± Hobbies & Interests

Gardening â€” I find peace and joy in growing herbs and vegetables, especially during spring and summer. Watching something grow over time reminds me of both science and patience.
Cooking â€” Experimenting with new recipes is one of my favorite creative outlets. I enjoy cooking traditional Chinese dishes and trying global cuisines.
Table Tennis & Badminton â€” Great ways to stay active and have fun with friends and family.
Mahjong â€” I love playing mahjong with friends â€” itâ€™s strategic, social, and always entertaining.
